title: Why are students interested in history? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here are my reasons:   Probably for the same reason that people love a good story. Because more often than not, that's exactly what it is.It opens the door to a number of other topics. Subjects such as economics, demographics, civics, linguistics, theology and psychology share direct links to history and one can certainly have a better understanding of them with some historic background.As mentioned already in other answers, there's always a lesson to be learnt. The phrase "History repeats itself" doesn't get the credit that it deserves.The realization that there was a time long before you came along. And (most probably) it'll be there long after you're gone.

Greetings, History features all the intriguing examples of the human condition. Many students who think school is boring find areas of history to be of interest. Sometimes, a young person can relate to the trials a historical figure experienced. Developments in technology that have military or industrial applications are attractive to young people who are curious about how inventions influenced the world. Most students are interested in the arts, music, and entertainment. History is full of episodes of how creative works impacted society. Media also promotes interest in history. Shows such as Game of Thrones, Outlander, House of Cards, and Mad Men keeps historical recreations in front of millions of eyes. Best regards, AJG.
